author: Nico Amarca
title: An NYC Underground Fashion Star on What It‚Äôs Like Working With YEEZY
text:
YEEZY Season 5 has come and gone, but the content mill around the event has been ongoing. Thus far, we‚Äôve debated the collection‚Äôs successes and failures , figured out how you can get Kanye‚Äôs look for less and speculated what vintage sneaker may have inspired Season 5‚Äôs gloriously fugly YEEZY Runner . Now, we set our sights on the clan of youngsters who graced the catwalk (or jumbotron LED screen) in the actual show.
Meet Bari Diamond , aka ‚ÄúJacuzzi,‚Äù a 20-something creative currently tearing up the Big Apple‚Äôs fashion underworld. If Jacuzzi looks familiar, it might be because you‚Äôve seen him lurking about some smoggy after-hours shindig in East Jesus Nowhere Brooklyn or walking in Hood By Air ‚Äòs SS17 show last fashion week.
If you still can‚Äôt pinpoint where you‚Äôve spotted the bald-headed eccentric covered in occult symbol face tattoos, maybe our shoot with buzzy downtown streetwear store Homies Wonderland , where Jacuzzi works as head designer, rings a bell?
Either way, the emerging fashion star has been causing some commotion in NYC‚Äôs thriving underground community for a minute now, but could his YEEZY modeling gig finally be his big break? As we‚Äôve seen with show veterans Luka Sabbat, Amina Blue and Lil Yachty, a cosign via Kanye can boost one‚Äôs popularity overnight, or at the very least expose them to a wider, more mainstream audience (the follower counts don‚Äôt lie).
We caught up with Jacuzzi to find out how he ended up in the show, what it was like working with Kanye and what we can expect from him in 2017. (You‚Äôll have to bear with the answers, they‚Äôre a bit, um, ‚Äúcryptic‚Äù.)
Vibrate.
Three years on and off. I‚Äôm in Los Angeles or New Orleans other than that.
Wake up, get coffee, smoke trees with my siblings Mahi Montana and the most beautiful, Wigwam. Rearrange my anxiety into beautiful art as always LOL, then ‚Äúlalala $$$,‚Äù def working on get better at the ‚Äúlalala‚Äù though LOL.

Homies Wonderland / Highsnobiety.com Nico Amarca / Highsnobiety.com Amazing. Learned so much in two black excellence.
Nah cause I‚Äôm here, that‚Äôs all that matters. But shit was classics, I feel like he expressed the ideas he mentioned in the show.
Poppin‚Äô bottles, well that‚Äôs what me and Mahi Montana were doing, and with the loveliest of ladies.
Some thinks I‚Äôm beautiful, hah.

Everything.
Blue money diamonds, my mother and me.
